intro: Urostigma saxophilum, commonly known as the saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features small, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are usually succulent, aiding in water retention in arid conditions. Urostigma saxophilum is often found in mountainous regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
